options.label: D

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: You would be able to increase the speed of the person's fall, making it more difficult to catch them.

options.label: D
options.text: You would be able to reduce the pressure exerted on the person's body, making it safer.

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's suggestion for how people can get more involved in the way that things happen to them, and what is the question they suggest asking?

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: The speaker is opposed to euthanasia, and their proposal is to make it illegal.

options.label: C
options.text: The speaker is neutral on euthanasia, and their proposal is to provide more education about the issue.

options.label: D
options.text: The speaker is opposed to euthanasia, and their proposal is to give people more control over their dying process.

title: Tracking grizzly bears from space - David Laskin

multiple-choice.question: What do grizzly bears primarily eat in the rocky mountains of Canada?

options.label: A
options.text: Up to 90% of their diet consists of meat from other animals.

options.label: B
options.text: They are almost exclusively carnivores, eating only fish and small mammals.

options.label: C
options.text: They eat a lot of plants, with up to 90% of their diet consisting of vegetation.

options.label: D
options.text: They primarily eat berries, nuts, and seeds.

multiple-choice.question: Why do grizzly bears in the rocky mountains of Canada need to hibernate during the winter?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they need to conserve energy and body fat during the cold winter months.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are highly social animals and need to spend the winter together.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are not adapted to the cold temperatures and need to escape to warmer climates.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are not skilled at finding food during the winter months.

multiple-choice.question: What do the NASA satellites use to track the growth and health of vegetation in the rocky mountains of Canada?

options.label: A
options.text: Infrared sensors to detect changes in temperature.

options.label: B
options.text: Spectral signatures, which are unique combinations of wavelengths of light reflected by different plant species.

options.label: C
options.text: GPS tracking to monitor the movements of bears.

options.label: D
options.text: Cameras to take high-resolution images of the landscape.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main goal of creating dynamic, time-lapse habitat maps for grizzly bears?

options.label: A
options.text: To track the movements of individual bears over time.

options.label: B
options.text: To identify areas of high-quality habitat and predict where bears will be foraging at specific times.

options.label: C
options.text: To study the behavior of bears in response to changing environmental conditions.

options.label: D
options.text: To develop a new method for estimating the carrying capacity of the study area.

multiple-choice.question: How can the dynamic, time-lapse habitat maps be used to predict the effects of climate change on grizzly bears?

options.label: A
options.text: By tracking changes in temperature and precipitation patterns over time.

options.label: B
options.text: By analyzing the spectral signatures of plants and how they respond to changing environmental conditions.

options.label: C
options.text: By monitoring the movements of bears in response to shifting annual temperatures.

options.label: D
options.text: By using the maps to predict changes in the availability of food and the impact on bear populations.

title: Cheese, dogs and a pill to kill mosquitoes and end malaria - Bart Knols

multiple-choice.question: Why do mosquitoes prefer to bite some people over others?

options.label: B
options.text: Because they can smell the food that people have eaten.

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are attracted to people who are wearing bright colors.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of using dogs to detect mosquito larvae in water?

options.label: B
options.text: To attract the larvae with a chemical bait.

options.label: C
options.text: To find the larvae in the water so that they can be treated with insecticides.

options.label: D
options.text: To study the behavior of the larvae.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of using a tablet to make mosquitoes sick?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: To make them more aggressive.

options.label: C
options.text: To make them sick and kill them.

options.label: D
options.text: To make them more docile.

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential outcome of using the tablet to kill mosquitoes on a large scale?

options.label: A
options.text: It would lead to a shortage of mosquitoes in the environment.

options.label: B
options.text: It would make mosquitoes more resistant to the tablet.

options.label: C
options.text: It would give an opportunity to eliminate malaria as a disease.

options.label: D
options.text: It would make mosquitoes more attracted to humans.

title: What on Earth is spin? - Brian Jones

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between straight-line motion and spin in physics?

options.label: B
options.text: Straight-line motion involves an object moving in a straight line, while spin involves an object rotating or turning on its axis in place.

options.label: C
options.text: Straight-line motion involves an object moving at a constant speed, while spin involves an object accelerating.
